title: Looking for similar typefaces as used by Non Format
content:
Looking for typefaces similar to those used by Non Format -  
 [http://www.non-format.com/archive/look-at-this/1/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201083634/http:/www.non-format.com/archive/look-at-this/1/ "http://www.non-format.com/archive/look-at-this/1/")

Both this style and curved such as -  
 [http://www.suitcasetype.com/index.php?lmut=en&part=fonts&font=6](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201083634/http:/www.suitcasetype.com/index.php?lmut=en&part=fonts&font=6 "http://www.suitcasetype.com/index.php?lmut=en&part=fonts&font=6")

Not sure what the exact term is for this style font?

Please post similar typefaces, and any used in design :)
author: buda

comments.content:
<cite>Not sure what the exact term is for this style font?</cite>  
It's "fat":  
 [http://typophile.com/node/42643](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201083634/http:/typophile.com/node/42643 "http://typophile.com/node/42643")

And the two main subcategories seem to be Egyptian Fats and Geometric Fats.

Non Format seems to have based its Egyptian Fats off of Giza Nine Five. And there is a decent selection of other Egyptian Fats like Sabbath Black, Akimoto, etc.

As for the Geometric Fats, the selection seems not so great imo. Probably best to make your own for this style.
Check out Jeremy Tankard's Shire series

That look is so last year.

Nick Cooke

Ended up using Neutrino by Neutura - [http://www.neutura.org/Neutrino.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20100201083634/http:/www.neutura.org/Neutrino.html "http://www.neutura.org/Neutrino.html")

Thanks for all the help :)
